intro: Lepidadenia seloang, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by bright orange, berry-like fruits. Its roots and leaves are traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. The botanical features of Lepidadenia seloang make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
